5F52017B6E804C20B12E0B0FE9388A90.description: Create 2D or 3D works of design in analog and digital formats.

0A8E11D1B3E4407A963B655F4C8ED6C8.description: Understand the relationship of graphic design in context of audio production.

3A0CEFD46632447C99AB2358F0AFE2C2.description: Understand the relationship of graphic design in context of video production.

291009D2B4564111AA040635BD956A49.description: Demonstrate ability to proofread and edit various forms of copy for different audiences.

6FFEF10194734864BB2B7BED928660CD.description:
Demonstrate appropriate communication skills (i.e. telephone, e‐mail, texting, social
media, etc.).

3846AFF9DFAF4F68B593AEE1D26F7166.description: Articulate and write concise and accurate instructions/step by step process.

8F69B11E91E5442F8F04BD11AA82D9E1.description: Read and follow written and oral instructions.

F1BB03F361374017A94D901172C43978.description:
Write logical and understandable statements or phrases to fill out documents used in
business and industry (i.e. forms, invoices, proposals, etc.).

97E75110C43045B897AB524EE98E9B7F.description: Apply inches to points and points to inch conversion problems.

E79778DAC53948AF8F56DEA0F6596EAD.description: Apply basic ratio and proportion problems.

396A4C48B94A4B47A1111962628090BB.description: Apply fraction to decimal and decimal to fraction conversion problems.

6B18F912D81F48348A316F32B4138476.description:
Apply addition, subtraction, multiplication and division of whole numbers, fractions, and
decimals.

6DBB4E93474240EBB67D3A284C6474D2.description:
Understand the elements of the critique process, including a respect for peer work and
the ability to give and receive dispassionate and constructive criticism.

E460483FE51D4683AAD1BA01DD2FF4F8.description: Recognize that portfolios are dynamic and require maintenance.

A79C3CFB8B6442448785351BBC058459.description: Develop portfolios that include various types of media.

DEFCF8A0ED354F40B261ECBB72FC1E67.description: Research and compare the various types of portfolios.

762E53A23E014057A37BED72991CA855.description:
Understand creative commons, the concept of usage rights versus ownership rights, and
the importance of using a release form.

F78B2838A058458BA97740A71255C62A.description: Model fair use in production of visual communication products.

0DF41AC30109408B86A749C969E0D4B9.description:
Define and debate fair use including authorships, rights of use for work and likeness, and
credit lines.

BE730F6EFE324E0F8A475ACB16C32CDA.description: Discuss consequences of violating copyright, privacy, and data security laws.

713F1184521242D9B5B4087DBBCB3126.description: Research laws governing brand issues, trademark, and other proprietary rights.

1FD6066D31144B06A2E0D7A284A6AEB2.description:

photography, illustration, audio and video rights), and software licensing.

0952E2745955435796A02DCB87A86806.description:

formats.

C685EA8CE51940F1B5706A9F44ED4F67.description: Analyze branding and corporate identity, its purpose and constituents.

98F12D6DC5894E809430D014F9C8CEB8.description: Apply the design process to generate different media formats.

E45C8083E47749AB82C061278E10EA8A.description: Explain the design process in different media formats.

53CC1149A90941A6BA26DF43E3B3C440.description:
Demonstrate the use of the graphic design process (define the project, develop budget

approval, pre‐press, production and final product delivery).

48B19851DB5C4C6CB665BBECCA6DDCD4.description: Develop a workflow for a project.

43D72F601D024E558F4C420A3736A4E9.description:

Use appropriate resolution, compression, and file formats for various media outputs

Use a variety of devices and media to import/download photos, images, and other digital
media content.

C222E56E7CD1414587826B4B3A4AC696.description:
Practice image composition, cropping, and the use of vector paths and raster channels in

26C7D6B840B34C0BBDFD4DFB32619782.description: Apply nondestructive image editing techniques such as layering and masking.

E4C3E193DAE7457C83340EA5DCFCF4EF.description: Incorporate the use of image manipulation and illustration software into final products.

1701005704E540C482832C17D72071FD.description:
Use a variety of devices and media to import/download photos, images, and other digital
media content.

BA538D6B063A443BA5D36FF85EAEDA30.description: Analyze differences and appropriate applications of vector‐based and bitmap images.

956874F40CC54522AC5E33C154C0DACD.description: Synthesize information collected from communications with various stakeholders.

67672A346851413C97075FD0059A1699.description: Explain the importance of developing a message for a specific audience.

4BCE50E4EE7348EEB83D2E766EE883DF.description: Create a storyboard for a project.

3ADC16D692FB4F9889714D3DB3637978.description:
Generate project ideas through the use of brainstorming, thumbnails, roughs, mock‐ups,
wireframes, etc.

58AC87FE101C47A3B66C4C01B465A668.description: Explain the methods used to control visual hierarchy.

567E410FE0FF494CBBF7BCB656664792.description:
Describe visual hierarchy and how it is used to control the viewer’s eyes through a

DD92A53441E140AB812E67480F43502D.description: Apply measurement tools and ratio analysis to image positioning in graphic works.

9EA8AA9E71804756B0731809A57A5946.description:

yearbook, etc.).

3254FC2AFB8849C290B66F710D2F1400.description: Utilize rule of thirds, simplicity, and/or complexity, etc. in layout.

31203E053B184604AC9DC1C275345D18.description:
Apply effective use of negative space, composition, message structure, graphics,
etc., to graphic works.

E85B6BD0A0F640C2803BBB4E83FEC35C.description: Principles and Elements of Design to Layout

9B96774ACC6244008512AB4E977C766C.description:

proximity, movement, harmony, emphasis, unity, etc.) in student‐generated graphic
works.

Analyze the principles of design (i.e. balance, contrast, alignment, rhythm, repetition,
proximity, movement, harmony, emphasis, unity, etc.) in samples of graphic works.

Incorporate color, line, shape, texture, size, and value in student‐generated graphic

Identify the applications of color, line, shape, texture, size, and value in samples of
graphic work.

work site visits.

terminology.

B7EB8AF72A4444D4AE237B3E7A5EF2E6.description:

impact graphic design.

29914C3FE2674D2B837EEC2E20816656.description:
Describe past and present styles, and how they will affect future styles in the graphic
design industry.

98B4EBA077874016BC6F24279A5EF39E.description: Research the history of technologies that advanced the graphic design industry.
